results.name: Table T(n,k) = |n-k| read by antidiagonals (n >= 0, k >= 0).
comment: Commutative non-associative operator with identity 0. T(nx,kx) = x T(n,k). A multiplicative analog is A089913. - _Marc LeBrun_, Nov 14 2003
For the characteristic polynomial of the n X n matrix M_n with entries M_n(i, j) = |i-j| see A203993. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 04 2018
For the determinant of the n X n matrix M_n with entries M_n(i, j) = |i-j| see A085750. - _Bernard Schott_, May 13 2020
a(n) = 0 iff n = 4 times triangular number (A046092). - _Bernard Schott_, May 13 2020
link: Peter Kagey, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
formula: a(n) = |A002260(n+1)-A004736(n+1)| or a(n) = |((n+1)-t(t+1)/2) - (t*t+3*t+4)/2-(n+1))| where t=floor[(-1+sqrt(8*(n+1)-7))/2]. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 24 2012; corrected by _Altug Alkan_, Sep 30 2015
If b(n) = a(n+1) - 2*a(n) + a(n-1), then for n >= 3 we have
b(n) = -1 if n = (j^2+5j+4)/2 for some integer j >= 1
b(n) = -3 if n = (j^2+5j+6)/2 for some integer j >= 0
b(n) = 4 if n = 2j^2 + 6j + 4 for some integer j >= 0
b(n) = 2 if n = 2j^2 + 8j + 7 or 2j^2 + 8j + 8 for some integer j >= 0
Triangle t(n,k) = max(k, n-k) - min(k, n-k). - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 26 2018
Triangle t(n, k) = |n - 2*k| for n >= 0, k = 0..n. See the Maple and Mathematica programs. Hence t(n, k)= t(n, n-k). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 04 2018
a(n) = |t^2 - 2*n - 1|, where t = floor(sqrt(2*n+1) + 1/2). - _Ridouane Oudra_, Jun 07 2019; Dec 11 2020
As a rectangle, T(n,k) = |n-k| = max(n,k) - min(n,k). - _Clark Kimberling_, May 11 2020
example: Displayed as a triangle t(n, k):
program: (MAGMA) [[Abs(n-2*k): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 07 2019
(Sage) [[abs(n-2*k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 07 2019
xref: Cf. A089913. Apart from signs, same as A114327. A203993.
